Variables
_hasReachedStopDegreeFlag

Used to make sure that the robot has reached the point even if it scanned the object at the other side

Functions
runScanRoomState

Main state function that performs scanning of the room based on where it is.

scanSelectedSide

Scans a selected side of the zumo and which degree to stop at.

Parameters
scanning_side

a character representing which side to scan

stop_degree

a float that represents a degree for the zumo to stop at

checkForObjectAtStart

Checks whether there's an object in front of it

hasReachedStopDegree

Checks whether a zumo has reached the point of the stop degree

Parameters
stop_degree

a float that represents a degree for the zumo to stop at

Returns

a boolean to say whether the zumo reached the stop point or not.

startMotorsBasedOnScanningSide

Start a motor based on the side of the scanning

Parameters
side

a character that represents a side being scanned by zumo

scanOtherSideOfSurvivor

Scans another side of the object after zumo detecting for the first time

Parameters
scanning_side

a character representing of what side is being scanned on zumo

original_scanned_degree

a float showing first object's detected sides

stop_degree

float representing a stop degree for when zumo should stop

send_message

Sends a message about the survivor

Parameters

degree: an integer representing middle distance between two points of the object's degrees.

returnToOriginalHeading

Makes the zumo to go back to a orignal heading (i.e. where the zumo would face the room in the first place) based on the side that the zumo is scanning.

Parameters
side

a character representing the side the zumo is scanning
